item.title: Acacia system returning to Royal Darwin Hospital emergency department despite concerns
item.description: The Acacia system was switched off at Royal Darwin Hospital's emergency department in January 2024 after it became a threat to patient safety.

item.title: Microsoft deploys fix for Azure cloud service after outage
item.description: Microsoft says it is rolling out a fix to address an outage of its Azure cloud portal which left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.

item.title: Redland Bay aged care employee charged after allegedly stealing debit card from 104yo man
item.description: Detectives started investigating after another employee at the aged care facility made a report on behalf of the 104-year-old.

item.title: NSW animal shelter under pressure over number of abandoned Rottweilers
item.description: An animal shelter specialising in large dogs works overtime to care for the number of Rottweilers being abandoned and surrendered in Australia, amid rising costs and funding shortages.

item.description: Claims are made of historical child abuse in camps run by a Potter's House church in Western Australia's Midwest.

item.description: Dion Prestia and Steven May are charged by police over their alleged involvement in a brawl in a Victorian coastal town last December.

item.title: Government refuses to release translation of public interview about opaque Nauru deal
item.description: The federal government has refused to release a translation of an interview with Nauruan president David Adeang concerning a deal with Australia to deport hundreds of people, despite the Nauruan government publishing the video on Facebook.

item.title: Drake appeals defamation loss over Kendrick Lamar's Not Like Us

item.title: Israel's strikes inside Gaza highlight a complicated truth about the ceasefire
item.description: Despite more than 100 Palestinians being killed by Israel in little more than 12 hours, the ceasefire continues to hold, though that technicality does not mean much to those on the ground.

item.description: Going off the electricity grid has been transformative for Mudgee's Lowe Wines, which had been struggling with high power bills and supply shortages for years.

item.description: Australia is looking to continue a near-perfect tournament in Thursday's Women's ODI World Cup semifinal. This is all you need to know ahead of the blockbuster clash in Mumbai.

item.description: The Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commission found systems meant to keep governments accountable are so fragmented they are leading to authorities passing the buck on responsibility.

item.description: Dion Anthony Craig has been refused bail following the death of a 55-year-old woman at Ulmarra, NSW.

item.title: Survey reveals nine out of 10 NSW farmers are victims of crime
item.description: Widespread farm crime is frustrating rural communities, with almost 90 per cent of farmers in New South Wales reporting they have been victims.

item.title: Alcohol industry explores smaller packaging as consumers seek convenience
item.description: From wine in 187ml bottles to spirits in sleek aluminium cans, producers are downsizing to meet a growing demand for convenience and variety.

item.title: David McCormack on Bluey, Custard, and the power of popular music
item.description: From indie rock to children's TV icon, David McCormack has done it all — and now he's back with a new album and zero expectations.

item.title: Lawyers move to block Nauru deportations over lack of adequate healthcare
item.description: Human rights lawyers have applied to intervene in the High Court case of a man facing deportation to Nauru, arguing the government should be barred from deporting people to places where they face death or serious harm.

item.title: Potential tornadoes, giant hail forecast from supercell storms in eastern Australia
item.description: Australia's storm season shifts into top gear, and the next 72 hours will deliver a combination of rain, showers or thunderstorms to the eastern two-thirds of the country.

item.title: Why Australia's spring housing market this year is set to go into overdrive
item.description: NSW sees a 16.8 per cent increase in new property listings during spring — ringing true to the age-old saying this time of year is the best time to jump into the housing market.

item.title: North makes history with 24th consecutive AFLW win, Carlton finals-bound after win in the west
item.description: North Melbourne becomes the first male or female VFL/AFL team to win 24 consecutive games after prevailing over Hawthorn by 49 points.

item.title: Pursuing critical minerals could come at a cost.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australia's pursuit of critical minerals holy grail could come at great cost
item.description: Researchers warn Australia's pursuit of a critical minerals industry could come at a significant cost.

item.title: Alex de Minaur upset by Alexander Bublik again in Paris in repeat of Roland Garros heartbreak
item.description: Alex de Minaur suffers another nightmarish defeat in Paris at the hands of his old tormentor Alexander Bublik.

item.title: Trump wants to resume US nuclear weapons testing. This is what it could look like
item.description: The US has not conducted nuclear weapons testing for 33 years. Now Donald Trump is calling for a resumption, raising concerns about what that may involve.

item.title: Interest rates will fall again when inflation returns to target but that could require a painful adjustment
item.description: And until someone — redundant workers, big business, the RBA or government — foots the bill, interest rates are unlikely to budge from here.

item.title: Usman Khawaja has seen politicians 'all over cricket', now he's joining other athletes to get action
item.description: Cricketer Usman Khawaja is one of the highest-profile Australian athletes who regularly wades into political issues. Now, Khawaja and other athletes have agreed to form a Players' Coalition to influence policy change on issues ranging from racism and human rights to social media abuse.

item.title: Trans people push to make healthcare more inclusive in the regions
item.description: A Queensland trans man says healthcare workers did not fully understand his needs when he sought fertility treatment.

item.title: Is the AI bubble too big to burst?
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australia's childcare crisis forces us to reconsider how we organise care
item.description: This is not the first revelation about how we treat the most vulnerable in our society but such reports persistently reveal a deeper, and more distressing malaise about Australian society.

item.title: How the Lions conquered their growing pains to reach AFLW top four
item.description: After a shaky start to the season the Brisbane Lions showed faith in a shift in game style to climb up the ladder and guarantee themselves a top-four finish.

item.title: Queenslanders urged to prepare as severe storms, giant hail and flash floods forecast
item.description: South-east Queensland faces a dangerous supercell outbreak on Saturday, with forecasters warning of giant hail, flash flooding and possible tornadoes.

item.title: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli admits there's a 'long way to go' on key issues after one year in office
item.description: In an interview with the ABC, David Crisafulli reflected on one year in power, reiterating the big four crises he campaigned on remain a priority.

item.title: Suzanne Rees died alone on Lizard Island. How did it happen?
item.description: Suzanne Rees joined a hike on Queensland's Lizard Island as part of a cruise stopover. She would never make it back to the boat.

item.title: Rome wasn’t built in a day – and neither was the Queensland school exam crisis
item.description: It didn't take long for news to spread that year 12 students in nine Queensland schools had been taught the wrong topic for their final ancient history exam, leaving teenagers "angry" about the "crazy" mistake.

item.title: Emergency doctors say RAH admitted more patients than bed limit, SA Health denies claim
item.description: The Australasian College of Emergency Medicine says on a day in September there were 70 admitted inpatients in the Royal Adelaide Hospital's emergency department that has 68 beds — a claim disputed by SA Health.

item.title: Holiday workers propping up key sectors exposed to serious workplace injuries
item.description: Many young people on the Working and Holiday Visa programs come to Australia to fill labour shortages in industries like meat processing and farming, but there are concerns around their health and safety in dangerous workplaces.

item.title: ABC Quote Quiz: Brutal weather, a prince evicted, gen alpha slang and nature being weird … again
item.description: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

item.title: The Canberra Liberals need to put their internal feud behind them. It's hard to see how they'll do that
item.description: After suspending two backbenchers from her party room this week, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has been silent. And it's hard to see how staying silent is helping Canberrans build trust in her party and her as the ACT's alternative chief minister.

item.title: Police investigate electric dirt bike crash as 15yo dies on the Gold Coast
item.description: A teenage boy has died overnight after falling from an electric dirt bike in Broadbeach.

item.title: Who made the 2025 Booker Prize shortlist, who missed out and who will win
item.description: 'Spiky characters' and 'luminous writing': Here's what we thought of the prestigious literary award's 2025 shortlist, the first with Sarah Jessica Parker as judge.

item.title: Pen pals enjoy 60-year friendship from opposite sides of the world
item.description: Sixty years ago in Canada, 12-year-old Diane Hatt went searching for a pen pal in Australia. She found one in South Australian Joy Doevendans and they've become best friends.

item.title: What are you going to pay for your aged care? Here are all the details
item.description: A new fee structure for aged care takes effect today. Find out what it will mean for you.

item.title: Quick and easy tomato and halloumi bake for busy weeknights - ABC News
item.description: This tomato and halloumi bake requires only a handful of ingredients, sliced and seasoned and popped in a baking dish.

item.title: She accused him of rape, but Prince Andrew's downfall is too late for Virginia Roberts Giuffre
item.description: In many ways, justice has been robbed from Epstein survivor Virginia Roberts Giuffre. Prince Andrew's stripped titles are a posthumous victory.

item.title: Nhulunbuy Tennis Club faces final serve as Rio Tinto mine closure looms
item.description: The impending departure of Rio Tinto raises concerns about the future of sporting clubs in Nhulunbuy. But there are hopes increased investment in regional sports can help sustain the community's active lifestyle.

item.title: Australia's heaviest trucks go electric with zero-emission freight depot
item.description: Australia's road freight is set to become the nation's largest source of emissions by 2030, but a NSW trial aims to show electric heavy trucks can cut carbon.

item.title: Tanzania election protests leave hundreds dead, main opposition party says
item.description: President Samia Suluhu Hassan this week held an election in which her main challengers were either jailed or barred from standing.

item.title: Buy Australian campaign aims to save dwindling domestic food manufacturing industry
item.description: Experts warn that Australian food manufacturing is under threat as shoppers turn to cheaper imported items, but the federal government is trying to promote locally grown produce.

item.title: Fathers and daughters, international rowing champions and wartime love feature in our top WA October photos
item.description: Our photographers this month illustrate a significant day for WA's history, a woman's struggle with her tiny home and a group of rowers competing on the world stage.

item.title: UN calls for end to US strikes on alleged drug boats in the Caribbean
item.description: US President Donald Trump has justified his attacks on boats in the Caribbean as a necessary anti-drug campaign.

item.title: Council investigates fixing road into Wolgan Valley three years after shutting it
item.description: A road into a largely cut-off community near the Blue Mountains that has been closed for three years because it was deemed too dangerous is being considered for repair.

item.title: Ballarat Grammar banned from accepting new boarders until proven safe
item.description: A prestigious private school in regional Victoria, accused of ignoring a toxic cycle of violence, has been banned from accepting new boarding students until it can prove it complies with safety standards.

item.title: Nationals ditch net zero support in party platform
item.description: The decision by the party's Federal Council does not bind federal parliamentarians but could pave the way for them to make a similar move as early as this week.

item.title: Rural students got game at Riverina leg of national FUSE Cup esport competition
item.description: Too much gaming time can be considered problematic. But, for these kids, it represents camaraderie, competition and the possibility of a future career.

item.title: Liam Gallagher incensed by flare let off at Melbourne Oasis concert
item.description: A flare let off by a crowd member at the first of three Melbourne Oasis concerts has angered the band's co-founder Liam Gallagher, sparking an expletive-laden post.

item.title: WHO confirms militia attack on hospital that killed 460 people in Sudan's Darfur region
item.description: The World Health Organization says the attack this week involved gunmen striking in several waves, abducting doctors and nurses, gunning down staff, patients and people sheltering there.

item.title: South African government criticises Trump's refugee policy prioritising white Afrikaner minority
item.description: On Thursday, the Trump administration announced its refugee policy would prioritise admitting Afrikaners, South Africa's white minority group.

item.title: Warren Tredrea was the Power's premiership captain, but has now been booted from its board
item.description: The Port Adelaide Football Club continues to describe Warren Tredrea as one of its greatest-ever players — but on Friday it dismissed him from its board of directors.

item.title: Japan wants to hire more bear hunters after record number of people attacked
item.description: In the past six months, there have been four times the number of people killed by bears compared with last year, and the Japanese government wants to hire hunters to help cull the animals.

item.description: The Australian government says it's "disappointed" after an international conservation meeting in Hobart failed to reach agreement on improved protection measures in Antarctica.

item.description: Giant hailstones, lightning and rain have lashed parts of the state's south-east with supercell storm activity reported.

item.title: Melbourne Cup 2025 field, horses, form guide and betting
item.description: Supporters of the favourite Half Yours are smiling after Saturday's barrier draw, but the forecast for heavy rain in the coming days could reshape the chances of the 24 contenders. Explore our interactive form guide to all the horses set to line up in Tuesday's great race.
